meanings.definition: To fry or cook with a sizzling noise.
meanings.sent1: I could hear the bacon frizzle in the pan.
meanings.sent2: She likes to frizzle vegetables in olive oil.
meanings.sent3: The eggs began to frizzle happily in the hot skillet.
meanings.sent4: The fish frizzled like fireworks on the grill.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the meat frizzling made my mouth water.

meanings.definition: To curl or frizz, as hair.
meanings.sent1: Her hair tends to frizzle in the humidity.
meanings.sent2: I used a curling iron to frizzle my hair for the party.
meanings.sent3: The wind made her hair frizzle into a wild mess.
meanings.sent4: Her hair frizzled like a lion's mane.
meanings.sent5: The heat caused her hair to frizzle into tight curls.

meanings.sent1: The frizzle of the potato chips made them extra crunchy.
meanings.sent2: Her hairstyle had a stylish frizzle to it.
meanings.sent3: The frizzle of the burnt toast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The frizzle of the leaves in the autumn breeze was beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The frizzle of the fried chicken skin was irresistible.
